text: That endpoint doesn’t support the same filters <https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/cms_email/get-all-marketing-email-statistics>
<@U9KA594Q3> thanks, my mistake in thinking it did. i wish it did though

Is it possible for a Marketing Email Subscription Type to have "Interests" that a user can check/uncheck so that we know we are sending them the emails they want to receive? I have created active lists based on product pages they have visited,  forms they have filled out, etc, but I prefer for the user to have a greater amount of control around the emails he/she is receiving. Has anyone found a way to do this yet?
I created a "preference center" using a form and landing page, that allows people to update those sorts of things.
<@UKGV272KS>, would mind sharing a screenshot to get some inspiration?
I can't, but there are plenty of examples online with a quick search. For example: <https://explore.reallygoodemails.com/7-really-good-unsubscribe-pages-preference-centers-dbf7e838aea5>

Hi all, I’ve been calling against the email events API endpoint using this simple pythonic code pattern (for single email campaignIds)

```all_events = []
while hasMore:
    response = requests.request("GET", URL, headers=headers, params=querystring).json()
    all_events += response['events']
    hasMore = response['hasMore']
    offset = response['offset']
    
    querystring['offset'] = offset```
Now, what I am returned doesn’t line up exactly with the CSV that I am provided with from HubSpot when I request a download for the same email campaign. Has anyone noticed this before and done any troubleshooting around it?

I wish HubSpot would allow you to paste in an entire HTML email (not Design Manager) as a campaign. At the moment I have a client that’s taking my code and pasting it into an HTML module in the drag and drop editor which invariably leads to broken emails.

When I explain that to get fully custom emails they need to spend over $1,000/m they laugh in my face!
